column1: #Text=, which literally means " over Daugava " or " across the Daugava " , is a part of Riga , comprising the west bank of Daugava river .
#Text=The international airport is located here , and the airport bus ( #22 ) stops at several places in Pārdaugava on it 's way to the central railway station .
#Text=There is also a dense network of trams , buses and trolleybuses providing access from other parts of Riga .
#Text=Getting in by car can also be an option .
#Text=The left Bank of the Daugava River in Riga is less frequently visited by tourists .
#Text=( Cross the Vanšu bridge over the Daugava ) .
#Text=An island in the city centre with Nordic dwelling architecture and a beach that is very popular in the summer .
#Text=A 368 meter-high tower built of concrete and standing on three legs , this is the tallest tower in the European Union .
#Text=It has an observation deck at a height of 97 metres .
#Text=The inexpensive tours feature a tour guide but do n't depend on the guide speaking much English ! € 3.70 .
#Text=An important part of the West Bank 's cityscape , the National Library was built in 2008-13 .

#Text=It is perhaps the most remarkable part of the " New Riga " giving a more gentle feel to skyscrapers and other high-tech buildings that were recently constructed on the West Bank of the Daugava .

#Text=The building was nicknamed the " Castle of Light " ( Gaismas Pils ) , and the architect intended to mimic the towers of Vecriga , although casual tourists may rather see it as a cruise ship that has just arrived from the Baltic Sea and is anchored across the river from the Old Town .
#Text=Check out the Riga Aviation museum , which contains several rare aircraft .
#Text=( Botaniskais Darzs ) , Kandavas iela 2 ( Tram 4 to Dzirciema iela , then walk east down Jurmalas Gatve towards the entrance ) , ☏ +37167450852 , ✉ botaniskais.darzs@lu.lv .
#Text=Apr-Sep 09:00 - 19:00 , other months 10:00 - 16:30 , Butterfly House has shorter opening hours ( check website ) .
#Text=The Botanical Garden is quite large and featuring an impressively broad and well-cultivated collection of plant species .
#Text=The long history of the Garden is reflected in its rich built heritage .
#Text=There is a Butterfly House within the garden 's grounds , where you can experience free-flying tropical butterflies .
#Text=Apart from botanical interests , the garden is simply beautiful and great for a stroll .

#Text=A very picturesque historical part of Pārdaugava , in 19th century it was a district for mansions and manors , some of which still remain ( although bereft of any grounds ) , and some were replaced by slightly newer early 20th century residential architecture of wealthy middle and upper class .
#Text=To get here , take Tram 2 , 4 , or 5 ; bus 21 , trolley bus 9 .
#Text=Very nice part of Pārdaugava with old wooden buildings , which date back to the 18th-19th centuries and are still preserved in between Nometņu , Slokas , Eduarda Smiļģa and Talsu streets .
#Text=This unusual place is the pearl of Pārdaugava ’s wooden architecture , a visit to it will bring an unforgettable aesthetic pleasure .
#Text=You may start with getting off at the stop “ Smiļģa iela ” tram #2 .
#Text=There are also nice wooden buildings on Kalnciema iela ( starting with crossing with Slokas iela till the crossing with Sabiles iela ) .
#Text=( Uzvaras piemineklis ) ( Get off the tram at the second stop after the bridge over the Daugava ) .
#Text=A splendid example of high Soviet art and the biggest occupation-era monument in Latvia .
#Text=If you 've never seen a Soviet monument before , you should really check this out .
#Text=Exhibits several collections of Soviet rolling stock .
#Text=( Eduard Smilgis Museum of Theatre ) , Eduarda Smiļģa iela 37/39 ( tram #2 , stop Eduarda Smiļģa iela ) , ☏ +37167611893 .
#Text=Located in the eccentrically designed and furnished pre-war house of a former director of Riga Daile Theatre and one of the key figures in Latvian theatre of the 20th century .
#Text=Its decorations are fairly plain , but the location among the trees is remarkable .
#Text=Built in 1913-16 , this church had neither a tower nor a dome and resembled a simple residential building .
#Text=Baptist services continued until 1961 and resumed shortly after Latvia re-gained its independence .
#Text=However , the very presence of a big methodist church in Riga is remarkable .
#Text=The interior of the church was partly designed in 1950s despite the official atheist propaganda that was widely imposed in the Soviet Union .
#Text=There is a popular beach on Kipsala Island , just across the Vanšu Bridge from the city centre .
#Text=( Āgenskalna tirgus ) , Nometņu iela 64 ( Tram 2 or trolleybus 5 - Āgenskalna tirgus stop ) , ✉ agt@apollo.lv .
#Text=This is a smaller counterpart to the Central Market , to be found the central square of Āgenskalns on the left bank of Daugava , which is a crossing of no less than 6 streets .
#Text=An impressive building from 1911-23 , remarkable as a red-brick manifestation of Jugendstil architecture in Riga .
#Text=While the offerings are decisively not geared towards tourists , you may want to visit just to experience the historic low-rise neighbourhood .
#Text=Several sets of home-like food are offered in a cozy atmosphere .
#Text=The Latvian pizza chain has three restaurants in Pardaugava .
#Text=The Rigan buffet restaurant chain also has a restaurant in the Spice shopping mall .
